lyrics.text: Lesson 54. Sticky fingers. First listen and then answer the question. What two interruptions
lyrics.translation: 第54课。粘糊的手指。首先听录音，然后回答问题。哪两个中断

lyrics.text: did the writer have? After breakfast, I sent the children to school and then I went to
lyrics.translation: 作家有吗？早餐后，我送孩子们去学校，然后我去了

lyrics.text: the shops. It was still early when I returned home. The children were at school, my husband
lyrics.translation: 商店。当我回家时，时间还早。孩子们在学校，我的丈夫

lyrics.text: was at work and the house was quiet. So I decided to make some meat pies. In a short
lyrics.translation: 我正在工作，家里很安静。所以我决定做一些肉饼。在很短的时间

lyrics.text: time I was busy mixing butter and flour and my hands were soon covered with sticky pastry.
lyrics.translation: 当时我正忙着搅拌黄油和面粉，不一会儿我的手上就沾满了粘糊糊的面团。

lyrics.text: At exactly that moment the telephone rang. Nothing could have been more annoying. I picked
lyrics.translation: 就在那一刻，电话铃响了。没有什么比这更烦人的了。我接起了电话

lyrics.text: up the receiver between two sticky fingers and was dismayed when I recognized the voice
lyrics.translation: 用两根黏糊糊的手指夹起听筒，当我认出那个声音时，我感到非常沮丧

lyrics.text: of Helen Bates. It took me ten minutes to persuade her to ring back later. At last I
lyrics.translation: 海伦·贝茨。我花了十分钟才说服她稍后再打电话过来。最后我

lyrics.text: hung up the receiver. What a mess! There was pastry on my fingers, on the telephone and
lyrics.translation: 挂断了电话。真是一团糟！我的手指上、电话上都沾满了油酥面团

lyrics.text: on the doorknobs. I had no sooner got back to the kitchen than the doorbell rang loud
lyrics.translation: 在门把手上。我一回到厨房，门铃就大声响起

lyrics.text: enough to wake the dead. This time it was Postman and he wanted me to sign for a registered
lyrics.translation: 足以唤醒死者。这次是邮差，他想要我签收一份挂号邮件。
